note.p: Markup was originally developed in Lisp where the obvious representation for a Markup document is as s-expressions, with each tree represented by a list whose first element is a symbol indicating the treeâ€™s tag.
note.pre: (:body (:h1 "This is a header") (:p "This is a paragraph") (:p "This is another paragraph with some" (:i "italic") " text in it."))
note.p: This kind of tree structure also has an obvious representation in XML or HTML:
note.pre:
This is a header

This is a paragraph

This is another paragraph with some italic text in it.
